title: BTS Announces Netflix Stream and Documentary for Comeback Celebration
summary: BTS, the Grammy-nominated K-Pop superband, has announced a major comeback event featuring a live concert stream on Netflix on March 21 from Gwanghwamun Square in Seoul. This performance celebrates the release of their fifth studio album, ARIRANG, on March 20. Following the concert, Netflix will premiere a documentary titled 'BTS: The Return' on March 27, offering an intimate behind-the-scenes look at the group's return after completing mandatory military service in South Korea. The comeback includes a world tour spanning 34 cities across 82 dates, with stops like London in July, marking their first global performances since 2019. During their hiatus from 2022, members pursued solo projects, but they reunited in June 2023. Netflix describes this as a defining cultural moment, highlighting the band's journey through doubt and rediscovery as they create new music. The documentary aims to explore themes of starting anew and moving forward together, resonating with millions of fans worldwide known as ARMY.

background_read: BTS, formed in 2013 by Hybe (formerly Big Hit Entertainment), has risen to global fame with hits that blend pop, hip-hop, and R&B, earning them a massive fanbase called ARMY. In South Korea, military service is compulsory for men aged 18-28, typically lasting 18-21 months, and BTS members enlisted between 2022 and 2023, leading to a group hiatus. During this time, each member released solo music and engaged in individual activities, maintaining their presence in the industry. Their comeback in 2023 signals a reunion that fans have eagerly anticipated, with Netflix partnering to amplify their reach through streaming. This event highlights the intersection of music, culture, and digital media, showcasing how global artists use platforms like Netflix to connect with audiences. Understanding K-Pop's impact and South Korea's cultural policies adds context to BTS's journey and their role in promoting Korean culture worldwide.
